My Journey

This is a unique mix my path‚Äîfrom the early days of exploring ideas to the milestones that have shaped my creative and professional life. It's a story of growth, learning, and continuous evolution.

Engineering Foundations

I began my career as a Mechanical Engineer, which basically meant spending half my time solving problems and the other half creating new ones by "Trying" things. Working on various projects in college teams, I quickly learned that good ideas need an engineer's foundation for solving problems from every angle, especially the ones I accidentally created in the first place. Somewhere along the line, I developed a real passion for solving problems from every angle, especially the ones I accidentally created in the first place.

Infosys Superleague (Shell Eco-Marathon)

In my college days, I designed a reverse-clutch mechanism‚Äîbasically my way of saying "I made something that actually works!" That's right, more mileage than my dad's car, and probably his driving skills too. That's right, more mileage than my dad's car, and probably his driving skills too. That's right, more mileage than my dad's car, and probably his driving skills too.

2008 Honda Civic Modification

My 2008 Honda Civic wasn't just a car; it was a blank canvas begging for personality. I dove into custom modifications and it was a candy store, swapping bumpers and upgrading internals like I was "tuning" a computer. And now "tuning" a computer. And now "tuning" a computer. It was a crash course in creativity, problem-solving, and learning how to fix things when they break (which was often).

Innovating and Leading

Sharing knowledge about CAD and the manufacturing of EVs with the young generation has been a lot like being a tech wizard showing magic tricks, except the magic is real and the audience is actually paying attention. I've mentored teams, led projects, and learned that the best ideas come from collaboration and a healthy dose of curiosity.

Continuous Evolution

Today, I continue to grow as a professional designer, embracing new challenges and exploring advanced design systems and AI-driven projects. My commitment to innovation and excellence drives me forward as I look toward the future of design.
